intro: Peristylus sphaerocentron, commonly known as the globular spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant features a short, stocky stem with dense clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate, simple, and have a waxy texture. Peristylus sphaerocentron is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
